intro: Oxalis lucumayensis subsp. woytkowskii, commonly known as the Woytkowskii wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is known for its ornamental value. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
